channel.title: Safeguard communications :: DevDocs Navigation Menu Test
channel.description: Secure Click here to give feedback about this page Content Notes Target personas: WIC App Developer,Experienced IAM developer Structure type: Navigation Content type: Guide Hub A guide hub is the main navigation page for a section, such as learn, plan, or build. It begins with “Who this section is for?” and how the user may have gotten to this page, i.e., where they are in their user journey at this point.

item.title: Secure your tokens
item.description: Secure your tokens Click here to give feedback about this page Content Notes Target personas: WIC App Developer,Experienced IAM developer Structure type: Navigation Content type: Autogenerated Index An autogenerated index is an automatically generated list of links to topics immediately beneath it based purely on the site’s structure, or with some level of filtering. A blind list of summaries and links to child docs.

item.title: Rotate your app’s client secrets
item.description: Rotate your app’s client secrets Click here to give feedback about this page Group Notes Group description: - No specific user research obtained for client secrets Client secrets are used in Authentication hence the reason why they are in Authenticate Content Notes Target personas: WIC App Developer,Experienced IAM developer Links to original docs: - Client secret rotation and key management: https://developer.okta.com/docs/guides/client-secret-rotation-key/main/ Structure type: Task Content type: How-to without code A “How-to without code” illustrates how to perform a specific task that does not rely on writing code.

item.title: Secure your Okta API authentication with JWTs
item.description: Secure your Okta API authentication with JWTs Click here to give feedback about this page Content Notes Target personas: WIC App Developer,Experienced IAM developer Links to original docs: - Build a JWT for Client Authentication: https://developer.okta.com/docs/guides/build-self-signed-jwt/java/main/ Structure type: Task Content type: How-to with code A “How-to with code” illustrates how to perform a specific task that involves writing code. The focus is geared towards developers integrating an SDK, API, or another library into their applications.

item.title: Add a third-party risk provider
item.description: Add a third-party risk provider Click here to give feedback about this page Content Notes Target personas: WIC App Developer,Experienced IAM developer Description: This document shows how to configure a third party provider using the API and create a simple event log. I think we could make this use case more robust and describe a better more detailed use case. This risk engine described in this doc can be useful in both secure and system log.
